# 1 Fathom Sportfishing Charters - Extended Information

## Business Information
- Name: 1 Fathom Sportfishing Charters
- Type: Fishing charter service
- Location: Jensen Beach, Florida (Treasure Coast)
- Service area: Jensen Beach, Stuart, Fort Pierce, Jupiter, Vero Beach, Port St. Lucie, Palm City, Hobe Sound, Sebastian, Tequesta
- Captain: Captain CJ
- Contact: (412) 979-4505 | salugac@gmail.com
- Website: https://onefathomfishing.com

## Trip Types & Pricing
1. 4 Hour Inshore Fishing Charter - $400
   - Year-round availability
   - Perfect for targeting snook, redfish, and tarpon in flats and backcountry waters
   - Indian River Lagoon and Intracoastal Waterway

2. 6 Hour Inshore Fishing Charter - $550
   - Year-round availability
   - Extended inshore trip for serious anglers
   - Trophy snook, redfish, tarpon in South Florida backcountry

3. 4 Hour Nearshore Fishing Charter - $450
   - Seasonal: Available April 1 - September 1
   - Nearshore Atlantic waters for kingfish, cobia, Spanish mackerel
   - Within 3 miles of shore

4. 6 Hour Offshore/Nearshore Fishing Charter - $600
   - Seasonal: Available April 1 - September 1
   - Extended offshore trip for sailfish, mahi-mahi, wahoo, kingfish
   - Offshore waters beyond 3 miles

## What's Included in All Charters
- All rods, reels, and tackle
- Live bait (when available)
- Fishing license for all passengers
- Catch cleaning and filleting service
- Water bottles
- Ice box for your catch

## Boat Specifications
- Type: 20' NauticStar bay boat
- Navigation: GPS and fishfinder
- Features: Live bait well, wireless trolling motor, ice box
- Capacity: Comfortable for up to 3 guests
- Small group size ensures personalized attention from Captain CJ

## Target Fish Species

### Inshore Species
- Snook
- Redfish
- Tarpon
- Spotted Seatrout
- Sheepshead
- Jack Crevalle
- Pompano
- Ladyfish
- Largemouth Bass (certain areas)
- Peacock Bass (Port St. Lucie area)
- Tripletail
- Flounder
- Bluefish

### Nearshore & Offshore Species
- Sailfish
- Mahi-Mahi
- Wahoo
- Kingfish (King Mackerel)
- Spanish Mackerel
- Cobia
- Grouper
- Goliath Grouper
- Barracuda
- Bonito
- Blackfin Tuna

## Launch Locations & Service Areas

### Jensen Beach (Home Port)
- Distance: Home port
- Access: Indian River Lagoon, Atlantic Ocean
- Best for: Inshore and nearshore fishing
- Target species: Snook, Redfish, Tarpon, Spotted Seatrout, Sheepshead, Jack Crevalle
- Best season: Year-round with exceptional spring and fall fishing
- Nearby: Jensen Beach Causeway, Indian River Lagoon, Bathtub Reef Beach

### Stuart (Sailfish Capital of the World)
- Distance: Home port
- Access: St. Lucie Inlet, Indian River Lagoon, offshore Atlantic
- Target species: Sailfish, Tarpon, Snook, Redfish, Grouper, Mahi-Mahi
- Best season: Year-round, peak sailfish November-March
- Nearby: St. Lucie Inlet, Indian River Lagoon, Stuart Beach

### Fort Pierce
- Distance: 15 miles north of Stuart
- Access: Fort Pierce Inlet, Indian River Lagoon
- Target species: Snook, Redfish, Tarpon, Cobia, Kingfish, Tripletail
- Best season: Spring through fall
- Nearby: Fort Pierce Inlet, Indian River Lagoon, Fort Pierce Beach

### Jupiter
- Distance: 20 miles south of Stuart
- Access: Jupiter Inlet, Loxahatchee River, Atlantic Ocean
- Target species: Sailfish, Wahoo, Kingfish, Snook, Tarpon, Goliath Grouper
- Best season: November-April offshore, May-September inshore
- Nearby: Jupiter Inlet, Loxahatchee River, Jupiter Beach

### Vero Beach
- Distance: 30 miles north of Stuart
- Access: Sebastian Inlet, Indian River Lagoon, Atlantic Ocean
- Target species: Redfish, Snook, Tarpon, Cobia, Spanish Mackerel, Pompano
- Best season: Spring and fall for best action, year-round opportunities
- Nearby: Sebastian Inlet, Indian River Lagoon, Vero Beach Pier

### Port St. Lucie
- Distance: 10 miles west of Stuart
- Access: St. Lucie River, Atlantic coast
- Target species: Snook, Redfish, Largemouth Bass, Peacock Bass, Tarpon, Spotted Seatrout
- Best season: Year-round with seasonal variations
- Nearby: St. Lucie River, Savannas Preserve State Park

### Palm City
- Distance: 3 miles west of Stuart
- Access: St. Lucie River, brackish waters
- Target species: Snook, Redfish, Tarpon, Largemouth Bass, Spotted Seatrout, Jack Crevalle
- Best season: Year-round, peak spring and fall
- Nearby: St. Lucie River, Leighton Park

### Hobe Sound
- Distance: 10 miles south of Stuart
- Access: Intracoastal Waterway, nearshore Atlantic
- Target species: Snook, Redfish, Tarpon, Spotted Seatrout, Pompano, Spanish Mackerel
- Best season: Spring and fall optimal
- Nearby: Hobe Sound Beach, Jonathan Dickinson State Park

### Sebastian
- Distance: 35 miles north of Stuart
- Access: Sebastian Inlet (highly productive fishing spot)
- Target species: Snook, Redfish, Tarpon, Bluefish, Spanish Mackerel, Flounder
- Best season: Year-round, exceptional during migrations
- Nearby: Sebastian Inlet State Park, Indian River Lagoon

### Tequesta
- Distance: 18 miles south of Stuart
- Access: Loxahatchee River, Jupiter Inlet
- Target species: Snook, Tarpon, Goliath Grouper, Redfish, Jack Crevalle, Ladyfish
- Best season: May-October inshore, November-April nearshore
- Nearby: Loxahatchee River, Jupiter Inlet, Coral Cove Park

## Policies & Important Information

### Cancellation Policy
- Free cancellation up to 3 days before trip date
- Cancellations within 3 days of trip: 100% charge
- No-shows: 100% charge
- Weather-related cancellations decided by captain for safety

### Family-Friendly Information
- Kids welcome on all trips (5+ recommended)
- Life jackets required for children under 6 years old
- Great learning experience for young anglers
- Captain CJ provides instruction and assistance

### What You Keep
- You keep all legal catch
- Check harvest limits and size requirements with captain
- Catch cleaning and filleting included
- Captain provides guidance on Florida fishing regulations

### Pickup & Transportation
- Pickup may be included based on location
- Contact captain to discuss pickup options
- Multiple launch locations available for convenience

### Safety
- USCG-compliant safety equipment on board
- Life jackets provided
- First aid kit available
- Captain prioritizes safety in all weather conditions

## Frequently Asked Questions

### What kind of fish can I catch?
Depending on location and season, you can target snook, redfish, tarpon, spotted seatrout, sailfish, mahi-mahi, wahoo, kingfish, cobia, grouper, and many other species. Inshore trips focus on snook, redfish, and tarpon in the flats and backcountry. Nearshore and offshore trips target pelagic species like sailfish, mahi, and wahoo.

### How much do charters cost?
Charters range from $400 for a 4-hour inshore trip to $600 for a 6-hour offshore trip. All equipment, bait, licenses, and catch cleaning are included in the price. 4-hour inshore: $400, 6-hour inshore: $550, 4-hour nearshore: $450 (seasonal), 6-hour offshore: $600 (seasonal).

### What's the best time of year to fish?
Fishing is available year-round on the Treasure Coast. Peak sailfish season is November-March. Inshore fishing for snook, redfish, and tarpon is excellent spring and fall. Nearshore and offshore trips are seasonal April-September. Each location has its own peak seasons.

### How many people can go on a charter?
Our charters accommodate 1-3 guests for a personalized fishing experience. Small groups mean more attention from Captain CJ and better fishing opportunities. The 20' NauticStar bay boat is comfortable for up to 3 anglers.

### What's included in the charter price?
All charters include rods, reels, tackle, live bait (when available), fishing license, water, ice, and catch cleaning/filleting. You just need to bring yourself, sunscreen, and any snacks or drinks you prefer.

### Do you offer pickups?
Pickup locations may vary based on the trip and location. We launch from multiple locations including Jensen Beach, Stuart, Fort Pierce, and Jupiter. Contact Captain CJ to discuss pickup options for your specific trip.

### What should I bring?
Bring sunscreen, sunglasses, hat, snacks/drinks (beyond provided water), camera, and weather-appropriate clothing. All fishing equipment is provided. Consider bringing a cooler if you want to transport your catch home.

### Do I need a fishing license?
No, your fishing license is included in the charter price. Captain CJ ensures all required licenses are on board.

### What happens if the weather is bad?
Captain CJ makes the final decision on weather safety. If a trip is canceled due to unsafe weather conditions, you'll receive a full refund or can reschedule. Your safety is the top priority.

### Can beginners fish on these charters?
Absolutely! Captain CJ provides instruction and assistance for anglers of all experience levels. Whether you're a first-timer or seasoned pro, you'll have a great experience.

## Fishing Type Comparison

### Inshore Fishing
- Location: Inside the coastline - estuaries, rivers, lagoons
- Waters: St. Lucie River, Indian River Lagoon, Intracoastal Waterway
- Depth: Shallow flats and backcountry waters
- Target species: Snook, redfish, tarpon, spotted seatrout
- Season: Year-round availability
- Best for: Anglers who enjoy sight fishing and technical casting

### Nearshore Fishing
- Location: Within 3 miles of shore in Atlantic waters
- Waters: Atlantic Ocean close to inlets and beaches
- Depth: 10-50 feet typically
- Target species: Kingfish, cobia, Spanish mackerel, bonito
- Season: April 1 - September 1
- Best for: Anglers wanting ocean fishing without long runs offshore

### Offshore Fishing
- Location: Beyond 3 miles from shore in Atlantic Ocean
- Waters: Deep Atlantic waters and Gulf Stream edges
- Depth: 50+ feet to several hundred feet
- Target species: Sailfish, mahi-mahi, wahoo, blackfin tuna
- Season: April 1 - September 1 (peak action)
- Best for: Anglers targeting trophy pelagic species and big game fish

## About Captain CJ
Captain CJ operates 1 Fathom Sportfishing Charters with a focus on providing personalized, affordable fishing experiences on Florida's Treasure Coast. With extensive knowledge of local waters and fish behavior, Captain CJ ensures every trip is both productive and educational. The small group size (maximum 3 guests) allows for individualized instruction and attention that larger charter operations can't provide.

- Service area: Treasure Coast from Sebastian to Jupiter
